description.text: Fire bad!
Cleans your curses away!
Used by blobbies to grind your equipment to dust.
Pew pew, fire!
description.monsterText: shoots a feeble-looking bolt of fire!

description.text: Pew pew, fire!
description.monsterText: shoots a reasonably impressive bolt of fire!

description.text: Pew pew, ice!
description.monsterText: hurls a somewhat ineffectual ice bolt!

description.text: Pew pew, ice!
Pew pew, ice!
Pew pew, zap!
Pew pew, zap!
description.monsterText: disgorges a lot of electrical current!

description.text: Rooted by facial hair! Dodging is more difficult, movement is impossible.
description.monsterText: uses its terrifying facial hair attack!
summons the cold winds of the north!
description.text: Summons the cold Winds Of The North to bedevil your foes and chill their flesh from the bone. Does damage over time and decreases their ability to dodge and their resistance to cold.
Damage your opponents with the power of Latin.
Revives a monster, just to annoy the player. Bastards.
description.monsterText: BRINGS THE DEAD BACK TO LIFE!

description.text: An aethereal missile. Nothing at all like Magic Missile.
This rage is monstrous!
You've caught an embarrassing and debilitating disease.
A smaller, gentler lightning strike. Indoor use only.
A smaller, gentler lightning strike. Indoor use only.
The power of electricity flows through your being!
This powerful acid burns flesh and armour alike.
Drains a corpse of its blood to gain (un)life. Bottoms up!
Dazzles your enemies, leaving them stunned by your spooky, sparkly vampire glamour. This also saps some of their life-force. Because seriously.
You are imbued with the brick-smashing strength of a plumber! Plumbers hate bricks.
You are imbued with lobstery toughness from this fungus. The lobsteryness can be knocked off of you in five hits.
You are imbued with regal vim.
You are imbued with arcane azure-hued magicks! Mages love azure.
Fell fungus has given you deadly fell powers.
You are protected by the power of plaid, well-known as a powerful defensive sigil.
The Greedy Blungecap gives you the ability to drain life from your enemies when you attack them.
Creates clouds of highly-confusing toxic spores.
Creates clouds of highly-confusing toxic spores.
The Fairywodger heals you by way of tingling fungal power.
By studying the lore of the Slime-herders from the Mushroom Jungles of Smome, you gain the ability to summon a fiercly loyal Slime Mold.
As the Mi-go once did (and shall again), you can summon living weapons of fungus to serve your will.
The spirit of a slain enemy fuels your magical power for a short time.
The stolen soul of a slain enemy enhances your arcane abilities.
Massive blood loss decreases strength.
A crippling wound impairs abilities.
Do it! Do it for Crom! (Your rage gives you extra strength and helps you ignore pain.)
Do it! Do it for Crom! (Your rage gives you extra strength and helps you ignore pain.)
Do it! Do it for Crom! (Your rage gives you extra strength and helps you ignore pain.)
To be armoured you must project the image of being armoured. This skill allows you to boost your defense for a short time.
It's only a flesh wound, just walk it off. Increases health regeneration and stubbornness for a short time after getting hit.

Practice being beaten, crushed and stabbed has made you highly skilled in these activities. When you get hit there is a chance that your health, burliness, and piercing resistance will increase temporarily.
The Tortoise Maneuver is not particularly feared by anyone because it mostly involves just holding your shield over your head and cowering, but it might help you survive a little longer.
Sometimes the best defense is to hit the other guy really hard on the head with your shield. Deals a large, crushing impact to an enemy, perhaps stunning them. Damage scales to Block Chance.
Fight smarter, not better! Can increase your defense for a while after you get hit.
Attack now with all the weapons *at the same time*! Your offensive abilities are increased -- until you get hit a couple times and your concentration is ruined.
You have a chance to strike your enemies with Teutonic Might! Hits one enemy very hard. Scales to Nimbleness.
Why go around when you can attack *through* your foe? This attack strikes your enemy and anyone standing behind them. Scales to Nimbleness.
Strike with the strength of your Viking ancestors!
Destroy all of those who dare to surround you with axe-wielding powers described in the ancient sagas! A circular area-effect attack.
This is the art of teaching your enemy how to back off. Hits an enemy with a blast that knocks them back.
Drops a veritable meteor of crushing violence everywhere in front of you!
This ability channels some of your mana into an especially powerful attack that takes place partly in the aetherial realm.
Extending your reach by mysterious, secret methods developed by a cheesemonger turned gladiator, this maneuver strikes at an entire swath of enemies.
Intense training allows you to shove large herd animals with surprising power. This skill has worldly applications, to boot.
A gale of flesh shall blow your opponents away. Does an area-effect attack which knocks back enemies.
Jump, jump!
Creates clouds of highly-confusing toxic spores.
Horrid toxic sludge covers everything, reducing defense and life-force.
Your vision is darkened, causing you to stumble more awkwardly through the dungeon.
For some reason, you never noticed how dark dungeons are before now.
This spell possesses the target with tentacular beings which do not belong in this reality; they will tear their way back to whence they came with destructive results.
They tickle!
Knit your flesh to make it whole! This is a healing spell, but be warned: casting this will temporarily weaken you as your wounds heal themselves.
Still-healing wounds leave you in a stubborn, regenerative state.
Bores the flesh of your enemies, sapping their strength and life-blood. Makes a bloody awful mess. More magic power makes the spell slightly easier to cast.
When the flesh grows weak, grow more flesh! This spell strengthens your body and your life-force. Requires some mana upkeep. Will be torn off if you take too many hits.
This spell makes corpses explode! Who doesn't like exploding corpses? ... Pretty much everyone, as it happens.
Give new life to the rather recently dead - as your undead Zomby minions!
Putrefies the flesh of the world to create clouds of noxious fumes that will cause any living being to become poisoned and choke. This spell essentially summons a cloud of toxic gas.
Summons a small disc of whirling blades whose entire goal in life is to cut something up bad. Real bad. It's not smart enough to move on its own.
Animates a small mustache golem to fight alongside you. (But where does the mustache come from?)
Animates a portion of your own living blood to fight alongside you in the form of a cute little blobby. Be mindful that this spell will sap your strength and life-force for a short time.
Using a large amount of blood in a recent summoning spell has left you in a weakened state.
First concocted by the Mad Architect Montresor, this spell grows a wall from the floor, crushing and moving any who stand in the spot. Delightfully unnatural.
This spells gives ablife to a blob of petroleum. Be mindful of using this spell around open flame...

Instills a cloud of thaumaturgons with a crude semblance of life and a terrible voracious fecundity. Let's break it down: Puts a cloud of hungry magic particles on a tile which are just jumping to infect and consume un/living beings.
A cloud of thaumaturgons comes alive and consumes beings it touches with thoughtless voracity.
The Lethian Mist spell was created by the little known mage Trog the Younger, after watching Trog the Elder succumb to senile dementia. Use it to confuse your foes for a quick getaway!
It lives! Gives live to a Robo to defend you, to hold you, to kill for you.
What was once formed, can be unformed.

This prototype teleportation spell was developed by Froda as part of a wizarding thesis project, 'A Study of Extra-planar Momentum in the 200 GeV Thaumaturgen Collision Range'. Its effects are considered unstable.
Can you subtract life itself? The Great Beklam discovered a way, much to his undoing. Curses an enemy, depleting their strength, agility, and life-force itself.
The curse of the Golden ratio was first used by the great Mathemagician Xeuclid to convert the flesh of his enemies into useful, useful gold. You just have to keep poking to be sure it takes.

The enhancement of one's own magical power is simply a function of correctly applying magical power. This effect can be combined with itself only three times, though we have top men working on breaking the fourth wall. It runs out after a time and drains your mana slightly.
A more refined (read: accurate) but more costly version of the Jump Discontinuity. We are assured that flesh-eating teleportation worms do not really exist.
This is the Curse that keeps on Cursing!
Sleep, now. Sends an enemy into relatively blissful slumber with a painful blast of tiredness.
Shove, now. Pushes enemies (and other things) around.
Lays magic crystals on the floor which release healing magic when they're stepped on. Ooooh.
You're a firestarter, a terrific firestarter. Blasts the target with prodigious fire.
Deals crippling existential damage to one being. Indiscreet use of this spell may provoke economic sanctions.
You move like they do. Your agility is greatly enhanced - until you get hit, and sense gets knocked back into you.
Magically charms a monster into giving up their evil ways to become your buddy ... for a short time. Then they just stab you in the back again.
You are repaying debt with blood.
A lingering weakness saps your life-force due to contact with dark magicks.
A dullness afflicts your mind due to contact with dark magicks.
You are repaying debt with blood.
You are repaying your debt with the strength of your flesh.
You are repaying your debt with your spirit.
You are repaying your debt with the power of your mind.
Blast your enemies to necromantic ablution with the Bolt of Evil. Be careful, though - use of this spell curses the caster with Nerve-Searing, Pain-Wracking Death-Thingies.

The dreaded Shobastian Nightmare Curse causes your enemies to fall into a blissful slumber. Meanwhile, their brains are beset by Eldritch Things who cunningly replace their internal thinkmeats with the Bees of Evil. Caution: exposure to Bees of Evil may prove to have toxic side effects to the caster.

Using this spell you may wear Chthon's Mark (which makes men mightier than mortals, and allows your attacks to send enemies into terrible nightmare realms). Requires mana to upkeep. Beware the cost to your humanity, of course.
In exchange for the power to steal the life-force of your enemies, you promise to give some of your life to some elder being. This bartering is not for the faint of heart.
This spell possesses the targeted being with an entity not of this reality; said entity will proceed to tear its way back to whence it came however it can, with destructive effect.
Opens a fearful un-rift into abwhere. Oh, the horror. The Horror.
Open one of your six mouths and sing the song that ends the Earth.

Thunder and storm with the triumph of your Magick Steele! This spell strengthens your attacks, gives your attacks electrical damage, and gives you a chance to do exceptional electrical attacks which may knock your enemies away. Requires some mana to maintain enchantment.
These summoned roots stop your foes dead in their tracks. Also with the crushing of the throat and all that. Stops movement for a short while, restricts ability to dodge.
These summoned roots stop your foes dead in their tracks. Also with the crushing of the throat and all that. Stops movement for a short while, restricts ability to dodge.
Summons the cold Winds Of The North to bedevil your foes and chill their flesh from the bone. Does damage over time and decreases their ability to dodge and their resistance to cold.
Your unholy warcry drives fear and weakness into the hearts of your enemies, reducing their ability to fight and, more importantly, to fight back.
The Hand of Belimawr is a fiery one indeed; it grants you fiery defense and fiery attacks and sucks up mana like you wouldn't believe.
Blinds those in a ring around you with a burning flash of light.

Surrounds you with a halo of light which illuminates the darkness (and your inner strength). Those who dare attack you are occasionally met with a blinding flash which stuns. The aura can only absorb a few hits before it is dissipated.
This magic rune uses the burning power of the sun to stop your foes dead ... in their tracks, at least.
The planets have aligned to grant you extra-ordinary agility, power, and constitution. Requires mana to upkeep.
With this shield of astrological power, the forces of the cosmos protect you. Usually. The effect will dissipate if it must absord too many hits. Requires mana to remain active.
With the stars aligned just so, terrible celestial energies are unleashed upon all around you.
This spell causes rock to explode from beneath an enemy's feet.
You can belch forth a jet of flame, not unlike that incident with the wager involving an entire barrel of Dwarven Rum. It sets anything in the way, including the floor, on fire.
This spell inscribes a magical fiery-exploding rune into the floor. Watch your step!

This fiery ritual summons a dragony friend who will happily set people alight and trigger traps for you. Like most Promethean spells, the summoning process has the side effect of shooting fire all over the place.
It's a giant fireball. It goes BOOM. Then with the burning. Oh god, the burning. What more do you want?

Summons a wall of fire from The Elemental Plane of Walls of Fire. Burns out over several turns as the otherworldly fuel-line succumbs to the Peak Mana crisis. Greater magical ability makes the spell easier to cast and the fire burn hotter.

By busting some sweet dance moves, you set the dance floor on fire, effectively setting all enemies around you on fire. Also more fire beyond that, it's really quite a mess. Greater magical power makes the fire all the hotter.
Deposits highly flammable oil all over the place.
Deposits highly flammable oil all over the place.
It's all right, you move in mysterious ways. Perfect for the inconspicuous exit from the scene of a crime.
By using your third, fourth, and sometimes fifth eyes, you can nearly see the future. This may prove useful in a scuffle.
Jack that mother.
Go for the cheap shot, right between the ribs.
Your magical powers are slightly drained for a short time due to infusing your essence into a wand. And you're going to go blind if you keep doing this.
By polishing your wand, you can recharge its mystical juice. (Note: mystical juice should not be mixed with wizarding liquid.)
Sometimes, necessity is the mother of adaptation.
It's not the years, honey, it's the mileage.

Recharges an anvil of Kron. The sad thing is, the Ancient Kronian Ritual mainly consists of sitting around the Anvil moping, drinking beer and complaining about why you can't get any Ancient Kronian Women.
Does anyone here speak English? Or even Greek?
This lucky lockpick keeps turning up, again and again. At the same time as itself. Again.
It's as if you were never there. Except for that dead guy.
If no one was watching, it wasn't a crime!
Locks up a targeted enemy with a handy chain. They won't be going anywhere for quite some time.
Steal an item, at random, for free! That said, this skill is deprecated and only in here for save/load compatibility issues. It was never that good in the first place.
Convert a gem into another more different gem.
Convert mushrooms into other mushrooms.
Plant fungal spores on a corpse and see what grows. Don't give me that look; it's just Nature's way of recycling.
Refreshes you a bit.
Refreshes you a bit more.
Refreshes you rather a lot.
Heals you a bit.
Heals you
Heals you
Your wounds close with unnatural speed.
Your limbs straighten and your flesh fills with unearthly regrowth.
Your body is being rebuilt with alarming speed, tendon upon bone upon skin upon viscera...
Sweet mana!
Replenishes your mana.
Replenishes your mana a lot.
You can see better in the dungeon's dark depths.
Your sight is much improved and helps you pick out critical weaknesses in your enemies' defenses.
Your vision reigns supreme; you can pick out every step and misstep in combat.
You have been infused with infernal power and can really feel the burn!
You have been infused with hyperborean power. Cool!
Shockingly, you have been infused with voltaic power!
For a short time, all you touch turns to gold. Well, bits of your enemies at least. Mostly.
For a while, all you touch turns to gold. Well, bits of your enemies at least.
All you touch turns to gold. Well, bits of your enemies at least.
You are imbued with great strength.
You are imbued with awesome strength!
You are imbued with colossal strength!!
For just a moment, it's as if you were never there.
It's as if you were never there!
No one can see you; time to make your escape.
You are quite thoroughly invisible - don't blow your cover!
This potion magically armours you.
Your skin hardens like iron around your body yet still bends like flesh. You are magically armoured! Getting hit repeatedly will cause this spell to lose its effect.
This potion magically armours you.
This potion enhances your health a bit.
This potion enhances your health.
This potion enhances your health a lot.
This potion is quite unpleasant.
This potion does vile things to one's innards.
This potion does unspeakably awful things to one's insides.
This being is doomed to die.
Your skin tingles as it sheds extra thaumaturgons; Magic's potency is increased around you.
Your hair stands on end as it is animated by excess magical energy; Mystical energy is powerful around you.
Your veins crawl with thaumaturgic power they cannot safely contain; You catch flickers of the tiny curled dimensions which you should not. Magic is deadly around you.
You glow with righteous radiance! This helps you see in the dark, makes you feel smarter than other people, and allows you to judge monsters with righteous fury.
You are infused with the power of dark magics which grant unnatural strength and necromantic energies.
Rooted by bolas! Dodging is more difficult, movement is impossible.
It's the lutefisk paradox, run!
Calls forth a boulder from The Elemental Plane Of Large Rocks That Fly Around At Dangerous Velocities which slams through foes, pushing them aside while mashing their squishy-bits to a fine paste.
Pew pew, laser!

fountain.name: Touch of Midas
fountain.text: You find a shiny penny in the fountain.

fountain.name: Invisibility
fountain.text: You feel transparent and at one with the water.

fountain.name: Medium Regen
fountain.text: Your body just got a little moister.

fountain.name: Clear Vision
fountain.text: When you gaze into the water, everything seems so clear...

fountain.name: Azure Magicks
fountain.text: There are little mushrooms growing in the water! How cute. Also, disgusting.

fountain.name: Plaid Power
fountain.text: The water irradiates you with mystical plaid energy.

fountain.name: Dire Empowerment
fountain.text: Your mind overflows with dark thoughts.

fountain.name: Acid Burn
fountain.text: The water burns like acid! The water IS acid!

fountain.name: Lingering Weakness
fountain.text: This water tastes foul! You feel sick.

fountain.name: Lingering Dullness
fountain.text: This water tastes foul! You feel stupid.

description.text: Ugh, looks like you overdid it a touch.
Hero needs food ... badly!
Power ... overwhelming. It burns like a chili cookoff!
The subject of this unfortunate curse finds their enemies' strikes landing rather more often than mundane statistics would suggest.
It's a giant fireball. It goes BOOM. Then with the burning. Oh god, the burning. What more do you want?
Blinds those in a ring around you with a burning flash of light.
Open one of your six mouths and sing the song that ends the Earth.
The Nightcap replenishing your mana with tingling fungual power.
A lightning strike inspired by the Wizard Tesla. Indoor use only.
Deals crippling existential damage to one being. Indiscrete use of this spell may provoke economic sanctions.
This moderately deadly acid burns flesh and armour alike. But just moderately.
Exposure to black magics has leapt from figurative to literal by dimming the light in yours eyes.
Will they ever learn?
Your magical energies have been suppressed by anti-magical energy forces.
Well, snap. There goes your magic.
Well, snap. There goes your magic.
Well, snap. There goes your magic.
The subject of this unfortunate curse has no defense against anything whatsoever. Jinkies!
You have a license to cast and to take away the right to cast. Any monster hit by this spell will lose their casting ability for a short time.
Effecting your knowledge of leylines, you are siphoning vital essence from the aethereal realm. Try not to anger any outer beings by doing this too much.

Extremely intense concentration allows you to greatly increase your mana regeneration for a short while. Such concentration may cause you to forget that you're in a dungeon filled with murderous monsters, so please be mindful of your surroundings when entering this state of mind.
Trying to care ... failing. Meh; ability to do anything useful is much reduced.
Your next attack is going to make a real splash.
Reveal all that is hidden.
Pew pew, laser!
Pour your blood and soul into a secret hidden thing that you can tap when the need is greatest.
Your vitality has been tapped by a unique form of blood magic.
Return vitality to your body!
Generates a ring.

fountain.name: Give Me a Ring
fountain.text: You find something in the fountain.

description.text: This technique, robed in rumour and behatted by hearsay, allows a crossbow bolt to hit with many times the force expected, knocking an enemy back and causing great damage.
This technique, robed in rumour and behatted by hearsay, allows a crossbow bolt to hit with many times the force expected, knocking an enemy back and causing great damage.
You've read an article in the back of Adventurer Monthly about this, now let's see if it works... (Theoretically turns a dodge into a counterattack. Sometimes.)
Infuse your weapon (or boot?) with a vile poison. Lasts for only a few attacks so make it count.
Jack that mother.
You are a deadly shadow - perform a sneak attack from nowhere and everywhere.
Keep up the momentum of combat for enhanced combat ability. Rip and tear!
Well, snap. There goes your magic.
A master of leylines can use invisible geometries to move-without-moving -- but only in cardinal directions. Be warned though, for moving through the aethereal realm greatly saps magical strength.
'Let my armies be the rocks and the trees and the birds in the sky...'
You can transform into a batty to make your escape. REEeee! (That's the sound a bat makes.)
It looks like you drank a little too much Diggle Nog.
Pew pew, ice!
An aethereal missile. Nothing at all like Magic Missile.
A lingering weakness saps your life-force due to contact with dark magicks.
A dullness afflicts your mind due to contact with dark magicks.
Sometimes you can dodge almost out of reality (and then back into it). Whether this ends up being a good thing is to be seen on a per-case basis. You may activate this ability at will.

Inspiration flows through your fingertips as booze through your still and potions through funny-shaped glassware, filled to the brim with foaming portent. (Spillage of portentious foam should be cleaned immediately as it has been known to leave Fateful Encrustment.)
This powerful acid burns flesh and armour alike.
A lingering weakness saps your life-force due to contact with dark magicks.
A dullness afflicts your mind due to contact with dark magicks.
By switching hands unexpectly you are able to launch startling, unsettling counteroffensives.

You are being watched by the Bolt Council. Do them proud, and they may reward you. Of course, no one konws exactly what the Bolt Council approves of, so to you it will seem like they randomly drop powerful arrows at your feet. Also, occasionally vending machines. On your head. Watch out for that.
The Bolt Council has elected to grace you with a vending machine. It appears broken, however -- I wonder what they intend to do with it?
Bones have been crushed! This is undeniably unpleasant, to say nothing of the utter inconvenience.
You butcher animals for their fresh, fresh, fresh meat. This occurs automatically in the midst of combat due to the butchering reflexes you've honed into muscle-memory, as they say.
A few of the planets have aligned to grant you mildly extra-ordinary agility, power, and constitution. Requires mana to upkeep.
A lingering existential despair saps your will to live.
A lingering existential despair saps your will to live.
An aethereal missile. Nothing at all like Magic Missile.
Pew pew, fire!
description.monsterText: shoots a reasonably impressive bolt of fire!

description.text: Give new life to the rather recently dead - as your undead Zomby minion!
What an awful mess!
Providing your enemy has veins, this attack spills the precious fluid contained therein. It doesn't work terribly well on undead robots made of wood. Damage scales to nimbleness.
What is more deadly than the attack never seen? This combat stance enhances your sneakiness and chance to score critical hits on enemies at the cost of raw melee power.

effect.name: Very Sharp Wall of Blades Stance

description.text: Pull the old Umkehrung on an adjacent opponent, switching places with them while sneaking in an extra daggery attack.

spell.name: Very Sharp Wall of Blades Stance

description.text: Who would dare try to breach a wall made of very sharp, very fast blades? This combat stance enhances your ability to block and counter attacks at the cost of raw melee power.

Just one wound inflicted by this most horrible technique will devour an enemy from the inside. This is not generally considered an honourable way to fight, no matter what the Monks of Assassination would have you believe. Damage scales by Caddishness.
When Count Tilly tells you to attack the fellow on the next street over, you find a way to make it work. This is a long-range linear attack which may stun enemies.
A sensible stance for uncertain times.
Victory is assured! (Probably.)
Why not attack from far away to better keep danger at bay? You begin now to understand why Talhoffer lived so long.

spell.name: Pope of the Polearm Mastery Sweep

description.text: Sweep aside your enemies like the dirt they are! Performs a stunning knockback area-attack.
You feel stronger; more aggressive...
Now you're starting to feel it.
You feel like a real Wizard!
YOU CAN DO ANYTHING YOU SET YOUR MIND TO.
Why is the room spinny?
It'sh all gone wrong, terribly wrong.
It's a confusing yet humourous glyph!
Healing Rain.
Where'd it go!?
Well, snap. There goes your magic.
The subject of this unfortunate curse finds their enemies' strikes landing rather more often than mundane statistics would suggest.
Your vision is darkened, causing you to stumble even more awkwardly through the dungeon.

Summons a wall of fire from The Elemental Plane of Walls of Fire. Burns out over several turns as the otherworldly fuel-line succumbs to the Peak Mana crisis. Greater magical ability makes the spell easier to cast and the fire burn hotter.
